Title: IM Track and Field Meet is TODAY!!!
Body:
* The IM Track & Field Meet is TODAY starting at 6:00pm. 
 
There is no need to pre-register, just arrive on the day of the event to the outdoor track from 5pm - 5:45pm for field events and from 5:00pm - 6:30pm for running events. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Dan O'Leary at oleary2@rose-hulman.edu or ext. 8987. 


 


 
2013 Intramural Track & Field Meet Information

 
Who: Open to all Rose-Hulman students (not 2012-2013 Rose-Hulman Track & Field team members), faculty, and staff. Male and female participation are both strongly encouraged!!! We will have both a Male and Female Champion for each event and division; Greek, Residence Hall, and Independent.

 
What: Intramural Track & Field Meet. There will be 9 different events.

 
When: The meet will be on Wednesday, April 24th starting at 6:00pm. There is no need to pre-register. Participants will register the day of the event at the outdoor track from 5:00pm - 5:45pm for field events and from 5:00pm - 6:30pm for running events.

 
Where: William Welch Outdoor Track & Field Complex, which is located in Cook Stadium.

 
Why: Intramural points will be awarded to the winning Residence Hall, Greek, and Independent participants towards the Intramural All Sports Championship (2 points for a first place finish). Also, the overall winning Residence Hall, Greek, and Independent team will receive 15 points. Awards will also be given to the winners (either a mug or t-shirt).

 
Additional Information: Below you will find the order of events for the Intramural Track & Field Meet. Also, attached to this posting is more information concerning the rules and regulations for the meet. You can find IM Track & Field information on the IM webpage www.rose-hulman.edu/Intramurals/IM_Classic. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Dan O'Leary at ext. 8987 or at oleary2@rose-hulman.edu. Thanks and have a great day!!!



 
Order of Intramural Track & Field Meet Events 

 
5:30pm Warm-ups Begin 
 
6:00pm Field Events Begin
· Softball Toss
· Long Jump
· High Jump
 
6:45pm Track Events Begin (Women/ Men)
 
Order of events are:
· 4 X 100 Meter Relay
· 800 Meter 
· 100 Meter
· 4 X 200 Meter Relay
· 1600 Meter
· 4 X 400 Meter Relay
 
8:00pm Estimated Conclusion


 
Scoring system for each event

 
Place   Points
1st          10
2nd           8
3rd            6
4th            4 
5th            2
6th            1


15 points will be awarded to the champions of the Greek, Independent, and Residence Hall teams. The above scoring system (1st through 6th place) is to determine the overall winner for each Greek, Independent, and Residence Hall. Once the overall winners for Greek, Independent, and Residence Hall are determined, the appropriate teams will then be awarded the 15 points to count toward the 2012-2013 overall point champions.

2 individual points will be awarded per event for 1st place finishes. These points will count toward the 2012-2013 overall point champions.
Thank you,
 

Dan O'Leary
Coordinator for Intramurals, 
Club Sports and Special Events
PHONE: 812-877-8987
CELL: 812-201-79035500 WABASH AVENUE CM 37
TERRE HAUTE, IN 47803-3920
www.rose-hulman.edu

Title: "Paint the Town Pink Carnation Sale"
Body:
CARNATION SALE
“PAINT THE TOWN PINK”

The Wabash Valley Breast Cancer Survivors, a non-profit group, will be selling dark pink carnations May 10, 2013, the Friday before Mother’s Day at the following locations:
WTHI, Hobby Lobby, Rural King, Meadows Shopping Mall by MCL, Stein Mart, Sam’s Club and in the lobby of Terre Haute First National Banks (Downtown First Plaza, the Meadows Bank, the Southland Bank, the Springhill Bank, the West Terre Haute Bank, the North Plaza Bank, Rosedale, and the Bank Operations Center.

The mission is to decrease the impact of breast cancer, increase breast cancer awareness and ensure that no woman has to face breast cancer alone.  The funds raised pay for mammograms for uninsured women in the Wabash Valley and for various other items.

Times at most locations will be 10:00 a.m. until 4:30 p.m. or earlier if all flowers are sold.

Please see the attached flyer with item pricing and the order form.

Title: ECE203 summer course needs one more person
Body:
Hi all,
The Summer session (SS1) of ECE203 still needs one more person enrolled for it to be offered, and enrollment closes on April 27th (Saturday). I and the others currently enrolled would greatly appreciate if one more person could go onto Banner and register. 






The email with details about summer courses follows:





Dear student:
Please continue reading this message if you are interested to enroll in the summer school at Rose-Hulman.

Summer School Timeline: 

The courses listed on Banner are tentative offerings for this summer school.  There are three sessions: Summer Session 1 (SS1: 5/30/13-7/3/13), Summer Session 2 (SS2: 7/15/13-8/16/13), and Full Summer Session (Online courses: 6/3/13-8/23/13).   
Any course listed may be dropped if there is not a minimum of 6 students enrolled by Friday April 27th. Almost all of the multiple-section classes would only be offered either SS1 or SS2 but NOT both. The final summer course offering will be available by May 1st.     

Registration procedure to enroll for summer classes: 

1) Registration for summer will be done via Banner Web just as it is done throughout the year.  As always, log into the Banner Web; go to the Student Menu, then Registration and Banner Schedule of Classes, then Register for Classes. 
2) Once in the Banner Web registration area, the registration PIN (or “Alternate PIN”) will be 123456.  
3) Select course(s) that you would like to take in the summer session of your choice. TBA for instructor means that there are multiple instructors interested in teaching the same course. An instructor will be selected when the final summer schedule is prepared.

4) Summer registration will be CLOSED by April 27th so a final summer schedule can be prepared. The final summer course offering will be made available on May 1st. 

5) You will be charged a $150 deposit for EACH course in which you are enrolled. The deposit is non-refundable and is returned only if the course is cancelled (special appeals will be heard by the Associate Dean of the Faculty on a case-by-case basis)

6) Summer school tuition is 60% of standard tuition for all courses
	$670.80/credit hour  (or $2,683.20 for a typical 4 credit hour course)
	Payment is due by May 15th

Feel free to contact me for any questions you may have.


Azad Siahmakoun

Azad Siahmakoun
Associate Dean of Faculty
Professor of Physics & Optical Engineering
Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology
5500 WABASH AVENUE
TERRE HAUTE, IN  47803-3920
PHONE: 812-877-8400
FAX: 812-877-8670
WWW.ROSE-HULMAN.EDU

Title: Sabbatical Talk - Life in Zambia
Body:
Life in Zambia
A Sabbatical Year Reflection

Dr. Matthew Boutell
Associate Professor
Computer Science and Software Engineering

Tuesday, April 30
10th hour
Olin 267

Abstract

Matt Boutell won a Fulbright Scholarship to lecture in the Computer Science Department at Copperbelt University (CBU) in Kitwe, Zambia for his 2011-2012 sabbatical. 

Rose-Hulman is a recognized leader in experiential learning in the undergraduate classroom. However, many schools in Africa use a more traditional lecture and recall approach. Matt will present his attempts to bring a Rose-Hulman style education to the students he taught at CBU.

Of course, much of what one learns when he spends the year abroad with a family of 7 takes places outside the classroom. As such, Matt’s talk will be infused with a healthy dose of photographs of various aspects of daily life in Zambia.

Title: IM Golf Scramble Registration Deadline is Today
Body:
* The IM Golf Scramble registration deadline is today!!
 
Please log onto www.imleagues.com and register your team by the May 1st registration deadline. The scramble will take place on Saturday, May 4th starting @ 1pm at Mark's Par 3. The fee is $20 per team, which is due to Dan O'Leary in SRC Office 265 D or CM 37 by the registration deadline. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Dan O'Leary at oleary2@rose-hulman.edu. Thanks and good luck in the scramble!!!



 



 
Intramural Golf Scramble


 
Who: Open to all Rose-Hulman students (not Rose-Hulman golf team members), faculty, and staff. Both male and female participation are strongly encouraged!!! There will be a separate champion based on gender and division (Greek, Res Hall, Independent). Coed teams are also allowed.


 
What: 2013 Spring Intramural Golf Scramble, which will be held on Saturday, May 4th starting at 1pm. Teams must consists of 4 players (can only take the first 18 teams). Play by scramble rules, which is playing the team's best shot. Thus, each team will turn in only once score for the scramble.


 
When: Registration begins Monday, April 22nd. The registration deadline is Wednesday, May 1st. Please log onto www.imleagues.com to register your team. The golf scramble will be held on Saturday, May 4th starting at 1pm.


 
Where: Mark's Par Three Golf Course, which is located at 2401 N. Chamberlain Street, just east of campus in Seelyville.


 
Why: Intramural points (15 pts) will be awarded to the winning Greek, Independent, and Residence Hall teams towards the Intramural All Sports Championship. Also, we will be having hole challenges; closest to the pin, longest putt, longest drive, etc.... Awards will be given to the team scramble and challenge winners.


 
Cost: An entry fee of $5.00 per player ($20.00 per team) is required before the end of the registration deadline. Please register online at www.imleagues.com, but submit your payment to Dan O'Leary at SRC Office 265 D or CM 37. Payments may be made in the form of cash or check, payable to Rose-Hulman Intramurals. Carts will be available upon request at the golf course for an extra charge (pay at golf course).

 
Thanks,
 
Dan O'Leary
Coordinator for Intramurals, 
Club Sports and Special Events
PHONE:    812-877-8987
CELL:        812-201-79035500 WABASH AVENUE   CM 37
TERRE HAUTE, IN  47803-3920
www.rose-hulman.edu

Title: Where all the chicks with cool cars at?
Body:
I climb tree and ride bike. Actually, I do homework and watch movies. As such, I have tickets to Iron Man 3 in IMAX 3D tonight at 9:00 P.M. in Indianapolis. My brother was going to drive me there, but he has a conflict, so I just need someone with a car who wants to go see it and would be willing to drive me down there. You don’t actually have to be a chick, and the coolness of the car is negotiable. I will pay for gas and the ticket is covered. We would need to head down there pretty early (leave at 6:30 or so) to make sure we get good seats and everything, so first come first serve and reply ASAP so I can plan this thing and stop stressing. You can contact me at baumbata@rose-hulman.edu

Thanks,
Travis Baumbaugh

Title: Free Iron Man 3 Ticket in Indy TONIGHT!
Body:
Free Ticket:

Iron Man 3
Tonight at 9:00 P.M.
Indianapolis
IMAX 3D

Yours if you drive me there. I will cover gas cost. My brother was going to go see it, but needs to study, so I need someone else to drive me there. Contact me at baumbata@rose-hulman.edu if interested.

It's at 9, so we need to get there around 8:00 or so to get good seats, so plan on leaving at about 6:30. I need to know A.S.A.P. if someone wants to do this, because 6:30 is approaching, and other people are in on this.

P.S. sorry for sending another sharepoint, but it was brought to my attention that while I thought the previous message to be attention-grabbing, it was also cryptic.

Thank you,
Travis Baumbaugh

Title: Need roomate for summer
Body:
Are you looking for a place to stay for the summer?  I am looking to rent a room in my house for $50 /week plus one-half of the electric bill (estimated to be around $80-120 / month depending on how much you run the air-conditioner). You will share the house with my 20-year-old daughter. The house is an A-frame on a lake near Riley. It is approximately 10 miles, or a 15-minute drive to Rose-Hulman. It’s only 5 miles (about 10 minutes) drive to Ventures.  If interested and would like to see pictures of the house, you can e-mail me and I’ll forward them to you.
 
You will have your own bedroom, and share the kitchen living room, and bathroom. You’re welcome to use any of the kitchen appliances and utensils. A washer and dryer are available. There is also a wrap-around deck, gas grill, and a dock on the lake with a fishing boat that you’re welcome to use anytime. I will be away all summer working in Dayton, Ohio. 
 
Call or email Dr. Deborah Walter if you want to see the place and meet my daughter. 
walter@rose-hulman.edu
mobile (812) 223-6521

Title: Wanted: Skilled User of the Blender Program
Body:
Hello Rose,

I am in need of the expertise of someone who knows how to use the Blender Project. The help I require shouldn't take long and may actually be quite trivial, but because I have no idea where to begin with Blender I thought it would be worth it to ask the Rose community for help.

I want to learn how to take a video game mesh file and create a 3D printer file (.stl) that I can use to make 3D printed models of objects in my favorite video games. I think that I am close to reaching this goal, but I have encountered a problem in the process and I believe Blender can provide the solution. 

Read on if you want to know the details of my situation.

Currently, I can take the game mesh, export it as an object file (.obj), open that .obj in Blender, and export it as a 3D printer file (.stl). However, that .stl file has features so thin that the printer can't make sense of it and SolidWorks doesn't like to open the file as a solid body (SW says there was a facet normal problem, idk what that means).

I have an idea about how to solve this problem, but I don't know how to implement it in Blender.

If a Blender user could contact me (gehriccd@rose-hulman.edu) I would greatly appreciate it.

Thanks for reading!

Title: Do you like butterfly knife tricks?
Body:
Even if you don't, read on!

Do you like to practice butterfly knife tricks, but don't want to get yelled at for having an open knife in class?  Then picture in your mind: a butterfly knife... but a PEN.  Plastic, finely weighted, perfectly safe to have in public places!

I lost a pen just like this (picture attached), with blue and red handles and a white middle bit, either on Speed Lawn or along the Union side of Speed Lake up until the dock.  If you happen across such a pen, I will give you the FULL amount that this pen is worth: $25.  You can have your own, super awesome, butterfly knife pen!  All you have to do is bring it to BSB 314.

If you don't give a fig about knives, you get the $25 anyway!

TL:DNR - Find a butterfly knife pen like in the attached picture, bring to BSB 314, get $25.

Contact me at: kassalje@rose-hulman.edu

Title: Selling 23.6-inch monitor, 20-inch TV, and mechanical keyboard
Body:
Hi All,

			My name is Simon Liang and I am graduating in 2 weeks (sadly). Since I live on the other side of the Pacific Ocean, it is impossible for me to bring all the things back.

			I am going to sell the following items:

			1. Hanns.G 23.6-inch monitor. 1920x1080 max resolution and has 2 little speakers on it. It is kept in prinstine condition. All I have is a VGA cable with me now, which I can give to you, but you can always get an HDMI cable to use it too. I am asking $50 for this monitor. Here is the newegg page for it and you can see the reviews for this monitor. (I think I might still have the extended warranty that I bought with the monitor from newegg, which extends the warranty to some time 2014)

			2. 20-inch Philips TV. I have been using it as a monitor and a small desktop TV for the past 3 years. It is also in great condition and I am asking $50 for this TV. Highest resolution for the VGA port is 1360x768, and it is a 720p TV.

			3. Rosewill Cherry-MX Blue Mechanical Keyboard. This is a mechanical keyboard which I love, but I got another one recently and I am going to sell this one for $50 as well. And for all the gamers out there, the brand of the keyboard really does not matter too much, because the key switches are the same. It is a little bit dusty and worn, but you can take the keys out and wash the keycaps and it is all good to go again (I can give you my plastic cap remover if you decide to purchase). Here is the newegg page and you can read the reviews (I got an older model so the keyboard cord is not detachable).

			I am attaching a picture of all these items. Of course there are a lot more things on my desk and if you are in deed interested in other items (Mac Mini, laptop, etc), we can talk it over on email as well if you wish.

			If you want to talk to me about buying one of these things, or the prices of these items, please email me at liangh@rose-hulman.edu

			 

			(For future reference, if you are want to write a fancy sharepoint like this, all you need to do is go to website like http://www.quackit.com/html/online-html-editor/, and type your message on the editor there, and click on the "source" button on the top left corner and the editor, and copy-paste the source code for it. I would make some software that will do that for you but I got 2 weeks left so..)

			Thank you so much and have a good evening.

			-Simon Liang

Title: SimplyWell Recipe Exchange - TODAY
Body:
SimplyWell Recipe Exchange
Tuesday, May 14, 2013
10:50 - 11:40 a.m.
HMU – PA Room


Do you want to add more healthy foods to your life? Do you have a great recipe that you want to share?
Please join us as we will be sharing our favorite healthy recipes. You are invited to bring your favorite recipe(s) to share. Please make 30 copies of your recipe(s).
To sign up, please log on to ANGEL and choose ROSExperience. Spouses are welcome to attend this event! 
SimplyWell participants may earn 250 points under the Wellness Events category. Please log on to SimplyWell's website and enter your points no later than June 15th.

If you have any questions, please contact Pam Pahnke at ext. 8916.

Title: Summer mobile / web application project
Body:
Good afternoon everyone,

I have a friend from Notre Dame who needs help.  He has this great idea for a new system but he needs a programmer to help.  I've looked at the problem for a bit and I've determined that it will be a combination of a mobile application and a web application with a database back-end.

If this sounds like something you would be interested in doing over the summer, please contact him at amathew1@nd.edu.

Thanks!

Title: Lenovo T400 For Sale
Body:
I have for sale my old Lenovo T400 Laptop. It has seen use, but is still a fantastic machine! In terms of physical condition, it shows some wear. Two of the USB ports  are broken as the plastic piece in them snapped out. That leaves one working USB on the unit itself, HOWEVER, I am including a PCMCIA USB 2.0 card with two ports that will work The hinge on the screen of the unit is a bit loose, but there are no issues with the machine staying open or closing. Some edges of the computer show some wear marks as well. Also, the vent on the left side has some plastic pieces broken One corner of the top piece is cracked. Finally, there may be some minor marking on the top of the computer form general wear.
I just did a fresh install of Windows 7 Professional- 64 bit and I installed the wireless card driver. You may need to download other drivers from Lenovo’s site to get everything working 100%. 
The specs of this machine:
2.53 gHz Intel Core2 Duo Processor
4 GB of RAM 
Wireless b/g/n wireless card
Ethernet card
Modem
Has discrete graphics- ATI Mobility Radeon HD 3400 Series AND the graphics chip on the Intel board
NOTE: You must install drivers from Lenovo (easy to do) to take advantage of both graphics cards
160GB hard drive 
1 working USB port (see above)
1394 port
VGA monitor port
Headphone jack
Microphone jack
Removable DVD burner
Built-in webcam
6-cell rechargeable battery but NOT GUARANTEE on battery life as it is the original battery. 
I am including some other items  as well so here is the whole list:
Laptop unit itself
DVD burner (removable)
Second hard drive hotswap bay(no extra drive included) (can be changed out with DVD burner)
AC adapter
Rechargeable battery
USB 2.0 PCMCIA card
Docking station-(this is a full featured station that you set the laptop on. Comes with keys to lock it. Search for “Lenovo 2504 dock” on Google for more information)
Please send me an email for more info/photos. I'm asking $175 for it.
milluza1@rose-hulman

Title: Anyone have a truck to tow-start my car?
Body: Hey everybody. My car seems to be having some issues. We've been narrowing down the problem, but aren't quite sure what it needs yet. What I do know is that while it won't start on its own, it can start if it is towed and then put in gear. This is like push-starting in concept, but requires less physical labor (as the car doesn't have to be pushed), and since I have tow straps, if anyone has a truck and wouldn't mind pulling my car up to speed, I would greatly appreciate it. This would be around 5:00 tomorrow, or earlier if I get out of my final earlier. Later is also fine, but I'd like to get going as soon as I can, so if you are available at 5:00, that would be ideal. You can contact me at baumbata@rose-hulman.edu

If any of the 10 or so people at Rose who live in Texas are passing here I'd greatly appreciate a ride. Obviously I'll help out with the gas. If this even remotely motivates, I have my own apartment there and I am willing to let any body LIVE THERE FOR 3 WEEKS FOR  FREE (or just sleep there,or run a home business, or just store equipment there, or have your pets stay there or something, I don't know and at this point I don't care.) NO QUESTIONS ASKED! If this doesn't appeal to the minority of Texans at Rose then COULD SOME ONE PLEASE GIVE ME A RIDE TOMORROW TO A LOCATION THAT IS ACTUALLY IN TERRE HAUTE?! You will be CompensateD with CapitaL!! andersre@rose....215-760-0469

Title: Books for The Ancient Medit. World
Body: I've got the 5 books used in the course for sale. If you think you'll take this class at some point, grab your books now for a reduced price - $30 total OBO. They go for about $70 total on Amazon. The books are: The World of Odysseus, Finley; The Histories, Polybius; The World of Late Antiquity, Brown; The Ancient Mediterranean World, Winks; and Lords of the Sea, Hale. Definitely a fun and interesting course to take! Email me at trumbade@rose-hulman.edu if you're interested.

Title: Special Olympics-We need YOU!!
Body:
We still need volunteers-especially on Saturday!!
We need YOU for Special Olympics!!
We are currently asking for volunteers to work on Friday, June 7 from Noon-4:00PM and Saturday, June 8 from 8AM-Noon and 1:00PM-5:00PM. Volunteers will be assisting athletes with completing TRAIN-a 14 station health assessment program (first of its kind). 
You can also bring along your significant other or children to volunteer as well! All volunteers will receive a free Special Olympics tee shirt! 
Please contact me-Merry Miller Moon, x8276 or miller2@rose-hulman.edu if you would like to volunteer. 
We are sorry for the lateness of this message. Additional information regarding job descriptions and more specifics will be forthcoming. 
Volunteering for Special Olympics is a fun and memorable experience. You will want to return year after year! J
Thank you,
Merry Miller Moon, Co-Captain Special Olympics Rose-Hulman, ext. 8276
Amy Harshbarger, Co-Captain Special Olympics Rose-Hulman, ext. 8462
Bernadette Ewen, Assistant to the Co-Captains Special Olympics, Rose-Hulman, ext. 8697

Title: New ROSIE Items
Body: Hello Everyone!!!

Title: Vigo County YMCA One Year Celebration
Body:
Join us for our Vigo County YMCA One Year Celebration
Saturday, June 15th from 8am to 2pm
The Vigo County YMCA would like to show our appreciation to the community! Join us for a day of celebration! The YMCA will be offering free use of the facility Saturday June 15th (excluding the pool which will be for members only). This includes free Adult and Youth fitness classes! See the schedule below:
8:15-9:00am Pilates/Yoga, Janice 
9:00 - 9:45am Butts and Guts, Janice
9:00 - 10:00am Youth Yoga Walk, Macy 
10:00 - 11:00am Advanced Boot Camp, Ernie 
10:00 - 11:00am Zumba, Ashley 
10:00 - 11:00am Youth Ballet, Kristalena (for Youth 6 to 13) 
11:00 - 12:00pm Zumbatomic, Linda (for Youth 6 to 13) 
11:00 - 12:00pm Burn it Off, Sarah 
12:00 - 1:00pm Zumba & Zumba Sentao, Eric 
1:00 - 2:00pm Aqua Zumba, Elizabeth 
Classes are for individuals who are 14 and older, unless noted otherwise. There are limits for numbers of participants based on space. Classes are subject to change.
For a $5 donation, Satibabi Inc. will be providing a lemon shakeup and a Satibabi, with all proceeds are going to the YMCA Summer Day Camp. Be sure to join us for fitness, food and tons of fun! 
For details call the Vigo County YMCA at 812-232-8446!

Title: FS: Computer tools and peripherals for sale
Body:
I have the following computer-related items for sale. If you are out of town for the summer and want to buy something I will hold it for you if you make a firm commitment to buy. Some of these items I have not been able to test; if any item does not work properly you can return it for a full refund. Send replies to john.m.gardner@rose-hulman.edu.
 
Curtis Computer Tool Kit with Chip Inserter. Eleven tools in a small black zippered case. Includes large and small phillips and flat screwdrivers, chip extractor tool, adjustable chip inserter tool including pin straightener, torx screwdriver with reversable blade, two socket wrench screwdrivers (shaped like a screwdriver but the tip is a socket), tweezers, and a small three-prong parts retriever tool for grabbing tiny little parts that you drop in semi-inaccessable places. Also includes a wrist grounding strap. Like new. $15.
 
Radio Shack 6-40 pin DIP IC Inserter and Extractor Set. [Radio Shack part number 276-1581; sells new at $11.99] According to Radio Shack, both tools are groundable. Like new. $5.
 
Rosewill 800DPI 3-button Optical Mouse RM-M5U with USB interface.
Like new in box. Tested and works fine. The third button is the scrolling wheel which also clicks. $5.
 
Pioneer External USB 2.0 DVD/CD Writer DVR-X152 with lightscribe. Includes drive, manual and power supply with cord. Excellent cosmetic condition; in box but without original packing material and box is creased in a number of places. I will include a USB cable, although it is not the original cable. No software included. $15.
 
Dynex 10base-T Ethernet Hub. Has four ports: one Ethernet cable comes in, four come out; splits your signal allowing 4 hardwired devices to share one ethernet connection. Includes power supply. No box or manual. $5.

Title: Summer House Sitting
Body:
Going on vacation this summer?
  Will stay in your home and care for your pets.
  Includes:
     Taking in mail and newspaper
      Watering houseplants
     Feeding/watering pets 1 or 2 times a day
     Cleaning litter box/bathroom area in yard
     Pet Playtime at least once a day
     Monitoring house on daily basis for power outages/leaks
 
Charges: Minimum charge $100 a week plus stocked kitchen for breakfast and lunches. This price includes care for one pet.
     Does not include lawn mowing/yard work
     Each additional house pet an additional $5 a day.
     Additional mileage fee may apply if you live outside of Terre Haute.
     Pets must be able to be on their own for up to 8 hours a day
 
  Make your reservations early before time slots get filled. References available upon request.
     Jacki Moore jacquelinesmoore@gmail.com
     Jessamyn Moore jessamynmoore@gmail.com

Title: Change in Location: SimplyWell Speaker - Fitness, Health, and Diet - Thursday, July 18
Body:
Fitness, Health, and DietThe Essentials for a Healthy Weight and Benefits of Living Well
 


Thursday, July 18, 2013
HMU - Kahn Room (Change in Location)
12:00 p.m. - 1:00 p.m.
 

Justin Lowry, B.S.
Union Hospital, Fitness Specialist
 


Learn about different ways to stay fit, how to determine your cardiovascular calorie burn, simple bodyweight workouts that can be done at home and on the go, the effects of what you put into your body and easy nutritional tips to keep you on track.
 

This session is open to all employees and spouses! Pack your own lunch or go through the cafeteria line. 
 

Please register via ANGEL. Spouses, please contact Pamela Pahnke at (812) 877-8916 or pahnke@rose-hulman.edu.
 
 

SimplyWell participants can earn 250 points by attending this event.

Title: Free Community Shredding Event
Body:
Saturday, July 20, 2013 • 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. 
Meadows Banking Center • 25th & Poplar in Terre Haute

First Financial Bank, Data Management Shredding, the Terre Haute Police Department, Union Hospital and VFW Post 972 will be on hand to collect and properly dispose of:

•	Personal papers you no longer need, such as tax forms, cancelled checks, bank statements, medical forms and pay stubs, that contain Social Security numbers and other personal information
•	Out-of-date medications
•	Worn-out American flags (which will be respectfully retired by the VFW)

 A limit of five boxes or five bags of papers per resident.

Title: Federal Work Study Job
Body: The Football Program will have work study jobs available for the upcoming year.  Your job will be Tuesday-Thursday from 4:45pm-6:45pm.  It will last until the middle of November.  In years past, most of the workers earned all their work study by the end of November.  There will also be an option to work on Saturdays for all 10 games.  Its a great way to make some money and work outside.  If you are creative you can also work on our recruiting videos.  If you are interested email davis5@rose-hulman.edu for more information.

Title: Hulman Union/Student Activities Office Has Work Study Positions Available!!
Body: The Hulman Union has various hours available to use your Federal Work Study Funds. Choose an evening shift (6-11:00 p.m.), afternoon shift (4-6:00 p.m.), weekend shifts, or we can work around your schedule from 2nd -9th hours. If you are interested contact Tracy Crosby at crosby1@rose-hulman.edu.

Body:
Student Body,

I am holding a secret to Terre Haute living. I have a location passed down to Rose-Hulman students since 2003. What does this mean? The same lease agreement has been continued since 2003. Same price. Same rules. Amazing.

Title: Corporate Olympics-We Need YOU!!!!
Body:
We need YOU! To be on the Rose-Hulman Corporate Olympics team!
We need four men and three women to compete on our team of eight.
 
What is Corporate Olympics you are probably asking yourself?  Corporate Olympics is sponsored by First Financial Bank.  Teams in Vigo County compete against each other in various physical games  - like walk on stilts, find the gumball in the plate of whip cream, running with eggs, and placing mixed drink straws in your lips to move a marshmallow from one plate to another.  
 
Food and drink (adult beverages) will be provided.  A half day of food, games and fun!
Last year, Rose-Hulman placed third in Corporate Olympics! J
 
***You have to be at least 21 years of age to participate***And like to have fun! 
 
If you are interested in being on the RHIT team, please contact Leanne Holder at x8825 or holder1@rose-hulman.edu
 
Corporate Olympics will take place on Saturday, September 14, 2013. 
The theme for Corporate Olympics this year is Team Building.  So come join me as I defend our ranking from last year.  
 
Note registration deadline is Friday.  PLEASE LET ME KNOW ASAP.  
 
 

 
 
Leanne D. Holder
Assistant Professor of Mathematics
Department of Mathematics
PHONE:     812-877-8825
FAX:           812-877-8883
 

Mathematics Department 
5500 WABASH AVENUE
TERRE HAUTE, IN  47803-3920
www.rose-hulman.edu

Title: For Sale: 2005 Saab 9-2x Aero
Body:
The car runs great and is excellent in the winter with its all wheel drive system, especially with the snow storms in Indiana. Although the car is branded as Saab, this particular vehicle was created in conjunction with Subaru so it is a Japanese manufactured car. Very reliable. Here is a link explaining what I am talking about ( http://www.caranddriver.com/reviews/2005-saab-9-2x-aero-road-test ).The reliability of this vehicle is up to par with Subaru. I am graduating this year and moving out of the state. KBB lists a goodprice of $8550 but I am willing to sell it for $8000 or best offer. The car currently has 113,XXX miles.

-5 Speed Manual Transmission
-Exterior Color: Black
-Interior Color: Black/White/Grey
-Sunroof/Moonroof
-Power Windows

If interested, please e-mail me for a list of service history. I have been going to the same mechanic ever since I've owned the vehicle and have a record of every service performed.

I will be honest as I can here to save you time in the future. There are some minor dents in the rear driver side door caused by a sideswipe. It is not noticeable when 20ft away. The tires need to be replaced as well as headlights so I am knocking off $550 from the asking price. To save some time for those interested, here is the link to the KBB site to check pricing (http://www.kbb.com/saab/9-2x/2005-saab-9-2x/aero-wagon-4d/?condition=good&vehicleid=1524&intent=buy-used&mileage=115000&options=59247%7ctrue%7c59268%7ctrue%7c59296%7ctrue&pricetype=private-party&r=575259895529598000#survey ) I have priced it in between "Good" and "Fair". Like I said, the body work is not perfect but it is mechanically sound. 

Overall this is a great car and has served me really well. Being a "wagon", there is a tremendous amount of cargo space. You can fold the rear seats down flat and have 2 people comfortably lay down inside.

Check out the Craigslist post for pictures: http://terrehaute.craigslist.org/cto/4012424130.html 

If you are interested please e-mail caijy@rose-hulman.edu, call or text me at 6462097956

Title: Inspired by Daphne Koller and want to try a MOOC?
Body:
If Daphne Koller's Opening Day Symposium speech inspired you to check out a MOOC, Stanford University is offering a variety of upcoming courses – from retirement finance, to cryptography, to entrepreneurship.  A list (hopefully, with hyperlinks) follows:

Title: Chemical Engineering Graduate Seminar
Body:
Date:  Monday, September 9, 2013
Time:  12:40 pm – 1:30 pm (6th period)
Place:  Room O206 (Design Lab)
 
Speaker: Dr. Joel R. Fried
Professor and Chair
Department of Chemical and Biomedical Engineering
FAMU-Florida State University
 
“Opportunities for Graduate Study in Chemical and Biomedical Engineering”
 
Please join us as Dr. Joel R. Fried, professor and chair in the Department of Chemical and Biomedical Engineering, discusses opportunities for graduate studies and research at FAMU-FSU. After his presentation, there will be time for Q&A and discussion of graduate career paths in the chemical and biomedical engineering disciplines.
 
Refreshments will be provided!

Title: SimplyWell Speaker - RHIT and YMCA - Tuesday, September 17
Body:
RHIT and YMCA
 
Tuesday, September 17
SRC - Multi-Purpose Room
9:55 - 10:45 a.m.
 
Deb Plummer Ringo
CEO, Clay County and Vigo County YMCA
 
Deb will conduct an information session on the Clay County and Vigo County YMCAs. This is a duplicate of the session in April 2013.
 
As a SimplyWell Program participant the benefits include:


Access to both the Clay County YMCA and the Vigo County YMCA facilities

A variety of group exercise classes that increase a sense of community and motivation to continue physical activity

Child Care for children 6 weeks to 6 years old while parents exercise at the YMCA facilities

Teen rooms for youth 6 years to 13 years old that provide supervised activity while adults workout at the YMCA facilities

Access to specialized intervention programs to address adult obesity/weight loss

Discounts for Youth Sports, School Age Child Care and Summer Day Camp programs

Volunteer opportunities
 
The benefits for the Institute include:


Enhanced and more effective SimplyWell Program

Less congestion at the SRC during peak hours


Improved connection of RHIT employees to the community

Improved employee/family satisfaction
 
The benefits for the Vigo County and Clay County YMCA’s include:


Sustainability

Prestigious partnership with RHIT

Increased volunteer base
 
Please register via ANGEL.
 
SimplyWell participants can earn 250 points by attending this event. Points must be entered within 90 days of this event to receive credit.
 
Questions? Contact Pamela Pahnke at ext. 8916.

Title: Fall Benefits/Wellness Newsletter is Available
Body:
The Fall Benefits/Wellness newsletter is available to view at: 
http://www.rose-hulman.edu/HR/SimplyWell%20Program/Fall%202013%20Wellness%20Newsletter.pdf

Some highlights of the newsletter include:
·         Final SimplyWell Screenings
·         Amendment to Health Insurance Plan 
·         Bike Share Program
·         SimplyWell Points Accrual Change

Title: IM Flag Football and Indoor Soccer Registration
Body:
* Registration for IM Flag Football and Indoor Soccer begins today, Thursday, September 5th. The registration deadline for both sports is on Wednesday, September 11th. Please be sure to register your team on www.imleagues.com by the September 11th registration deadline date. IM Flag Football will be played on Monday and Tuesday and Indoor Soccer will be on Wednesday and Thursday. If you have any questions or concerns about registering, please contact Dan O'Leary at oleary2@rose-hulman.edu or at ext. 8987.
 

 
 

IM Flag Football & Indoor Soccer Registration

Who: Open to all Rose-Hulman students (not Rose-Hulman football or soccer players), faculty, and staff. There will be Residence Hall, Greek and Independent leagues for both IM sports. 
 

What: Intramural Flag Football & Indoor Soccer leagues. Flag Football will be on Mondays and Tuesdays and Indoor Soccer will be on Wednesdays and Thursdays. 
 

When: Registration begins today, Thursday, September 5th. The registration deadline for both IM Flag Football & IM Indoor Soccer is Wednesday, September 11th. To register a team, please log onto www.imleagues.com. Click the Create Team button at the top right of your User Homepage. Games will begin on Monday, September 16th for Flag Football and Wednesday, September 18th for Indoor Soccer.
 

Where: IM Flag Football will be played at the IM Fields, which are just east of the outdoor tennis courts. IM Indoor Soccer will be played in the SRC Fieldhouse, which is located in the lower level of the SRC.
 

How to Register: Log in to your IMLeagues account. Click the Create Team button at the top right of your User Homepage or click the Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology link to go to our homepage on IMLeagues. The current sports will be displayed, click on the sport you wish to join. Choose the league you wish to play in (Greek A, Res Hall B, Independent C, etc...).
 

Why: Intramural points will be awarded to the winning Residence Hall, Greek, and Independent teams toward the Intramural All Sport Championship (the Residence Hall, Independent team, and Fraternity who have the most points at the end of the year will be awarded the overall Intramural Sports Champions and will be given the travelling trophy). Awards will also be given to the winning teams (either mugs or t-shirts).
 

Costs: A $10 forfeit fee is required. Please be sure to submit your $10 forfeit fee to the IM Office (either by taking it to the IM Office 265 D or sending it through campus mail to Dan O'Leary at CM 37) by the registration deadline (September 11th). Your team will NOT be scheduled until you submit your $10 forfeit fee per team.
 

Free Agents: An Intramural Free Agent is a Rose-Hulman student, faculty, or staff member who wishes to participate in an Intramural sponsored team activity and is not currently a member of a team. The Free Agent list will be posted in the Intramural Office. If you would like to be put on the Free Agent List, please do so by e-mailing Dan O'Leary at oleary2@rose-hulman.edu. When e-mailing, please include name, sport you would like to join, contact number, and e-mail address.
 

Additional Information: Attached to this posting you will find a copy of the rules for both sports. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact Dan O'Leary at ext. 8987 or oleary2@rose-hulman.edu. 
 

Hope you all have a great year here at Rose!
 

Dan O'Leary
Coordinator for Intramurals, 
Club Sports and Special Events
PHONE:    812-877-8987
CELL:        812-201-79035500 WABASH AVENUE   CM 37
TERRE HAUTE, IN  47803-3920
www.rose-hulman.edu

Title: FREE Amazon Student
Body:
Hey everyone. The school year just started and everyone's busy ordering textbooks and other necessities for the quarter. Often the cheapest place for this stuff is on Amazon.com.  

Amazon offers a great service called Amazon Student for anyone with a .edu email address (that's YOU!). Amazon Student offers discounted Amazon Prime ($40/year instead of $80 and this includes a free, no risk trial), great discounts for college necessities, and free instant video (as a part of Prime). 

If you're interested visit this link for more information and to register: http://www.amazon.com/gp/student/signup/info?ie=UTF8&refcust=6BBKSH3Y4XIYZ2FWDFQ3GO35T4&ref_type=generic

Thanks for looking and have a great rest of the year!

Body:
Another school year, another apocalypse. We're pulling out all the stops as the current group of admins prepares to hand the torch off to a new group. Prepare for an intense game that is designed to be challenging for grizzled veterans and overconfident freshmen alike.

This Friday the 13th, meet in E-104 at 7:30 PM with a Nerf gun, rolled up clean socks, a backpack, a red bandana, and any other supplies you think may be useful. Thrown darts is no longer an acceptable method of tagging a zombie, and foam melee weapons are prohibited.

Title: IM Dodgeball Tournament Registration

* Registration for the IM Dodgeball Tournament begins today, Monday, September 9th. The registration deadline is Thursday, September 19th. Please log onto www.imleagues.com to register your team. The tournament will be held on Tuesday, September 24th. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Dan O'Leary at ext. 8987 or oleary2@rose-hulman.edu. 





IM Dodgeball Tournament
 


Who: Open to all Rose-Hulman students, faculty, and staff. Male and Female participation are both strongly encouraged!!!
 

What: Intramural Dodgeball Tournament. The Residence Hall, Greek, and Independent Leagues will all be played on the same night, Tuesday, September 24th. 

When: Registration begins today, Monday, September 9th. The registration deadline is Thursday, September 19th. To register your team team, please log onto www.imleagues.com. Scroll over the player signup link and click the Create Team button at the top right of your User Homepage. The dodgeball tournament will be on Tuesday, September 24th starting at 6:30pm. 
 

Where: The dodgeball tournament will be held in the SRC Fieldhouse.
 

Why: Intramural points (15 pts) will be awarded to the winning Residence Hall, Greek, and Independent teams towards the Intramural All Sports Championship. Awards will also be given to the winning teams.
 

Cost: FREE!!! There is no cost to participate in the Intramural Dodgeball Tournament. 
Additional Information: The IM Dodgeball rules are attached to this posting. This information is also available on the IM webpage www.rose-hulman.edu/Intramurals/IM_Classic. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact Dan O'Leary at ext. 8987 or at oleary2@rose-hulman.edu.

Title: IM Tennis Registration
Body:
* Registration for Intramural Tennis begins today, Monday, September 9th. The registration deadline for IM Tennis is Thursday, September 19th. Please log onto www.imleagues.com to register yourself, or doubles team, by the September 19th deadline. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Dan O'Leary at oleary2@rose-hulman.edu or ext. 8987.





Intramural Tennis Registration

Who: Open to all Rose-Hulman students (not Rose-Hulman tennis players), faculty, and staff. There will be Residence Hall, Greek and Independent leagues for both singles and doubles. Please remember the rule, which allows individuals to participate in only one division; A, B, or C. Participants are still eligible to play in both singles and doubles. For more details, please read page 11 in the 2013-2014 IM Handbook.

What: IM Tennis leagues. There are not set days and times for IM tennis. You will contact your opponent and set up a day and time to play that is convenient for your schedule. Winners will then contact the IM Graduate Assistant, Brandon Smitley at smitley@rose-hulman.edu.

When: Registration begins today, Monday September 9th. The Registration Deadline will be Thursday, September 19th. To register as an individual or a doubles team, please log onto www.imleagues.com. Scroll over the player signup link and click the Create Team button at the top right of your User Homepage. IM Tennis will begin on Monday, September 23rd.

Where: Intramural tennis matches will take place on either the Joy Hulbert Outdoor Tennis Courts (located just east of Cook Stadium) or at the indoor tennis court (located in the SRC Fieldhouse). 

Why: Intramural points will be awarded to the winning Residence Hall, Greek, and Independent individuals and teams towards the Intramural All Sport Championship. Awards will also be given to the winners (mugs or t-shirts).

Costs: NO COSTS!!! There is no forfeit fee required when you register on IMLeauges.

Additional Information: IM Tennis rules are attached to this posting as well as instructions on how to register on www.imleagues.com. This information is also available on the IM webpage www.rose-hulman.edu/Intramuras/IM_Classic. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact Dan O'Leary at ext. 8987 or oleary2@rose-hulman.edu. 
 
Thank you!

Title: Spectroscopic experiments
Body:
Refreshments served.
 
Trudy Bolin
Beam Line Scientist
Argonne National Lab Advanced Photon Source
 
 
*The Department of Physics and Optical Engineering is pleased to announce that Trudy Bolin will give a presentation on Spectroscopic experiments at the Advanced Photon Source in Myers 137 beginning at 1:35 p.m. on Thursday, September 12, 2013.  
 
Thursday, September 12, 2013
Beginning at 1:35 p.m.
Myers 137
 
 
Abstract
Spectroscopic experiments at the Advanced Photon Source
 
            The Advanced Photon Source (APS) at the U.S. Department of Energy’s Argonne National Laboratory provides this nation’s (in fact, this hemisphere’s) brightest storage ring-generated x-ray beams for research in almost all scientific disciplines.  Spectroscopic techniques, such as X-ray Absorption Fine Structure (XAFS), are a powerful probe into the chemical behavior of many systems.
 
This talk will focus on the source characteristics of the APS and the optical components and operation of a typical XAFS beamline.  A relatively new application of XAFS to investigate bimetallic catalytic systems under real working conditions will also be discussed.
 
Refreshments served.

Body: The Terre Haute South Touchdown Club is providing an opportunity for people of all ages to come and participate in the first BRAVE RAVE COLOR COURSE.  This event features exciting pre and post course festivities, including snacks and many door prizes.  A variety of football/fitness related stations, such as the Lineman Lunge and Brave Biceps are included in the course.  As participants move through the course, they can add color to their white Brave Rave participation shirts, making this a one-of-a-kind colorful athletic event.  Anyone can participate.  It will take place Thursday, 9/19 with "kickoff" at 6:00 p.m.  It'll be at the athletic fields of Terre Haute South.

Title: IM Flag Football and Indoor Soccer Registration Ends Today
Body:
* The registration deadline for IM Flag Football and Indoor Soccer is today, Wednesday, September 11th. 
 
Please be sure to register your team on www.imleagues.com by the September 11th registration deadline date. IM Flag Football will be played on Monday and Tuesday and Indoor Soccer will be on Wednesday and Thursday. If you have any questions or concerns about registering, please contact Dan O'Leary at oleary2@rose-hulman.edu or at ext. 8987.
 
 


 


IM Flag Football & Indoor Soccer Registration
 

Who: Open to all Rose-Hulman students (not Rose-Hulman football or soccer players), faculty, and staff. There will be Residence Hall, Greek and Independent leagues for both IM sports. 
 


What: Intramural Flag Football & Indoor Soccer leagues. Flag Football will be on Mondays and Tuesdays and Indoor Soccer will be on Wednesdays and Thursdays. 
 


When: Registration begins today, Thursday, September 5th. The registration deadline for both IM Flag Football & IM Indoor Soccer is Wednesday, September 11th. To register a team, please log onto www.imleagues.com. Click the Create Team button at the top right of your User Homepage. Games will begin on Monday, September 16th for Flag Football and Wednesday, September 18th for Indoor Soccer.
 


Where: IM Flag Football will be played at the IM Fields, which are just east of the outdoor tennis courts. IM Indoor Soccer will be played in the SRC Fieldhouse, which is located in the lower level of the SRC.
 


How to Register: Log in to your IMLeagues account. Click the Create Team button at the top right of your User Homepage or click the Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology link to go to our homepage on IMLeagues. The current sports will be displayed, click on the sport you wish to join. Choose the league you wish to play in (Greek A, Res Hall B, Independent C, etc...).
 


Why: Intramural points will be awarded to the winning Residence Hall, Greek, and Independent teams toward the Intramural All Sport Championship (the Residence Hall, Independent team, and Fraternity who have the most points at the end of the year will be awarded the overall Intramural Sports Champions and will be given the travelling trophy). Awards will also be given to the winning teams (either mugs or t-shirts).
 


Costs: A $10 forfeit fee is required. Please be sure to submit your $10 forfeit fee to the IM Office (either by taking it to the IM Office 265 D or sending it through campus mail to Dan O'Leary at CM 37) by the registration deadline (September 11th). Your team will NOT be scheduled until you submit your $10 forfeit fee per team.
 


Free Agents: An Intramural Free Agent is a Rose-Hulman student, faculty, or staff member who wishes to participate in an Intramural sponsored team activity and is not currently a member of a team. The Free Agent list will be posted in the Intramural Office. If you would like to be put on the Free Agent List, please do so by e-mailing Dan O'Leary at oleary2@rose-hulman.edu. When e-mailing, please include name, sport you would like to join, contact number, and e-mail address.
 


Additional Information: Attached to this posting you will find a copy of the rules for both sports. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact Dan O'Leary at ext. 8987 or oleary2@rose-hulman.edu. 
 


Hope you all have a great year here at Rose!
 


Dan O'Leary
Coordinator for Intramurals, 
Club Sports and Special Events
PHONE: 812-877-8987
CELL: 812-201-79035500 WABASH AVENUE CM 37
TERRE HAUTE, IN 47803-3920
www.rose-hulman.edu

Title: Foster Cat Need Home
Body:
Hello,

My wife and I have been fostering a young cat for the humane society. We've seen her through spaying surgery and all of the shots necessary for adoption. She's now ready for a good home.

- She's estimated to be 1 year old.

- She's small, approximately 3kg or 7lbs.

- Her coat is tortoise shell. Her fur is very short.

- She is in perfect health and very energetic. She loves to play, snuggle, and be pet.

- She's been spayed. She's had nearly all of her shots. The last shot will be administered this week.

- She does not get along with other cats. **Do not adopt her if you have other cats.

- Cats can live to be 20 years old or older. Do not adopt her unless you are able to care for her for the next two decades. We saved her life after she was discarded by someone. We want her next home to be loving and permanent.

- The humane society will charge a small adoption fee and run a simple check, to be sure you're able to provide a good home.

My wife has prepared a short presentation for your enjoyment.

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B98b6RqmrrXYa3JwbzZLR1YxNGs

Please contact me with any questions: goulet@rose-hulman.edu

Thanks,
Dave

Title: Reminder: Spectroscopic experiments...
Body:
Trudy Bolin
Beam Line Scientist
Argonne National Lab Advanced Photon Source
 
 
*The Department of Physics and Optical Engineering is pleased to announce that Trudy Bolin will give a presentation on Spectroscopic experiments at the Advanced Photon Source in Myers 137 beginning at 1:35 p.m. on Thursday, September 12, 2013.  
 
Thursday, September 12, 2013
Beginning at 1:35 p.m.
Myers 137
 
 
Abstract
Spectroscopic experiments at the Advanced Photon Source
 
            The Advanced Photon Source (APS) at the U.S. Department of Energy’s Argonne National Laboratory provides this nation’s (in fact, this hemisphere’s) brightest storage ring-generated x-ray beams for research in almost all scientific disciplines.  Spectroscopic techniques, such as X-ray Absorption Fine Structure (XAFS), are a powerful probe into the chemical behavior of many systems.
 
This talk will focus on the source characteristics of the APS and the optical components and operation of a typical XAFS beamline.  A relatively new application of XAFS to investigate bimetallic catalytic systems under real working conditions will also be discussed.
 
Refreshments served.

Title: FREE Amazon Student
Body: Hey everyone. The school year just started and everyone's busy ordering textbooks and other necessities for the quarter. Often the cheapest place for this stuff is on Amazon.com. Amazon offers a great service called Amazon Student for anyone with a .edu email address (that's YOU!). Amazon Student offers discounted Amazon Prime ($40/year instead of $80 and this includes a free, no risk trial), great discounts for college necessities, and free instant video and e-book rentals (as a part of Prime). If you're interested visit this link for more information and to register: http://www.amazon.com/gp/student/signup/info?ie=UTF8&refcust=6BBKSH3Y4XIYZ2FWDFQ3GO35T4&ref_type=generic Thanks for looking and have a great rest of the year!

Title: IRC 10th Annual Undergraduate Research Symposium
Body:
Greetings, 
 
As you may know, each year, Rose-Hulman’s summer undergraduate research program (officially called the Interdisciplinary Research Collaborative, or “IRC”) hosts a symposium that allows students to present the results of their research projects. We plan to host the 10th Annual Undergraduate Research Symposium on campus on Friday, October 25. We are extending the abstract deadline to Friday, September 27. 
 
If you have performed research or project work and are interested in presenting, this symposium is a splendid opportunity for you to practice your scientific speaking skills, and is definitely a stand-out item on your CV/resume. Take advantage of this opportunity!
 
For more information, including guidelines for the Abstract, please consult the IRC website (http://www.rose-hulman.edu/IRC/symposium.html).
 
Thank you for your attention,
Peter Coppinger, IRC Director
Mark Brandt, IRC Director
IRC 10th Annual Undergraduate Research Symposium - Call for Abstracts

Title: Galaxy Note II Review
Body:
I've had the Galaxy Note II for over the summer and now for the start of the school year now. I'm quite impressed with it. The reason I bring this review to the campus community is because I've effectively replaced all of my class notebooks with my Note II. The Note II has a 1.6 GHz quad-core processor, an enormous screen, a stylus, and all of the hackability and rootability of the android operating system. I've also added a battery expansion to my phone, so I easily get a day and a half of heavy usage out of it, or two days of moderate usage. I can do almost everything on this thing from hooking it up to a keyboard, mouse, and monitor, to making calls, texting people, and playing Cut the Rope... 

Attached to this sharepoint, I have a couple examples of class notes, as well as a picture I drew in a sketchbook app. If you're thinking about getting a new phone, I would highly recommend the Galaxy Note II. If you have any questions, or simply wish to fuss about me spamming on the sharepoints.. shoot an e-mail to weldonla@rose-hulman.edu ... Have a wonderful day :)

Title: International Guest Speaker 9/19/13 - Prof. Dev. for ECE Students
Body:
The Electrical and Computer Engineering Department
presents
International Guest Speaker
Professor Frowin Derr
 Thursday, 19 September 2013          4:00 PM  M 111
Professor Frowin Derr, Dean of the University of Applied Sciences, Ulm Germany will present a talk on Compression in Communication Systems. Wonder how and why there are such filesjpeg, mp3, mpeg, etc. Come join him for an informative and intriguing introduction to the field of compression techniques within the field of communications. Starting with the compression technique associated with FAX transmission he will continue with the coding concepts and principles associated with several more advanced compression techniques and applications.
  Professional Development Credit available               for ECE students

Title: On-Campus Job Still Hiring! $9.50/hr
Body:
Be a part of the Rose Hulman Phonathon team. We call alumni, parents, and friends to raise support for the Rose Hulman Institute of Technology. 

•	Walking Distance: We are located in Hatfield Hall
•	Goal oriented environment: Daily personal and team challenges 
•	Flexible hours: Everyone on our team is required to work two shifts a week, including one Sunday shift. We call Sunday through Thursday from 5:30 to 9:00 and Sunday afternoons from 1:30 to 5:00. 
•	Open to all students (Work study and Non-Work Study): Pay is $9.50 per Hour
•	Rewarding experience: Know that at the end of the day you are giving back to your college.
•	Excellent resume builder: Develop your communication and negotiating skills in a professional environment. 
•	Apply today! Training now!

Interested? 

Please contact Wes Kayser by phone at 419-302-6956 or by email at wesley.kayser@ruffalocody.com to set up an interview.

IM Dodgeball Tournament

Title: House Roommate Wanted (Check This Out!)
Body:
I currently have a large bedroom at my house that can be rented (even has a remote ceiling fan/light). There are currently two RHIT students living at this residence. One is a boy and the other is a girl, both ChE. There is plenty... plenty of communal space... and just space in general. There is even a study room/office. 

The location is 10 minutes away from school. The house is on Home Ave. This is one street East of Kroger Foods on Wabash. 

Rent: $185 + utilities. 
Utilities and rent usually make the monthly total for each person (3 persons) about $225-250 per month. This includes internet, cable, gas, electricity, and water.

It might also be worth mentioning that the house is rigged with a security system. It has a fully functional kitchen (uses gas stove). The house has a porch.  Also, there is a nice washer and dryer installed. Additionally, the landlords are good friends of mine so they tend to our every need quickly. 

Let me know if you are interested. This opportunity could even benefit people who want to terminate their current lease with say, for example, VQ. You could be saving money in the long run. However, do not abandon your roommates. So, if you aren't happy with your living decision you most definitely should want to check this out. 

Email Me: markleaf@rose-hulman.edu

Title: Missing jacket
Chemistry and Biochemistry Seminar
Body:
Plasmonics in Metallic Nanostructures – A Correlated Approach 
Vighter Iberi 
Wednesday, Sept. 25
4th Hour, G317
ABSTRACT 
A large number of optical phenomena rely on the unique ability of metallic nanostructures to concentrate light on length scales that are smaller than the diffraction limit of visible light. Noble metal nanoparticles such as silver and gold have optical properties that make them suitable for various applications including solar energy harvesting, and surface-enhanced spectroscopy. These special properties result from an excitation of the localized surface plasmon resonance (LSPR), which is a collective oscillation of the conduction band electrons. LSPRs are known to depend strongly on the size and shape of the nanostructure and can be excited by both electrons and photons. 
Our research focuses on correlating plasmons excited by light (resonance-Rayleigh scattering), with plasmons excited by electrons (electron-energy loss spectroscopy), from the exact same nanostructures. Our approach is twofold. (1) We are imaging plasmon modes in single nanoparticle structures as well as nanoparticle aggregates and correlating these measurements with optical scattering measurements and fully 3D electrodynamics simulations of the exact same structures. (2) We seek to image directly the plasmons give rise to the surface-enhanced Raman scattering in molecules and establish the location of the molecule relative to the plasmons which underlie these optical scattering spectroscopies. 
BIOSKETCH 
Vighter Iberi is from Lagos, Nigeria and received his BS from Campbellsville University in 2008. He is currently a 5th year graduate student in Dr. Jon Camden’s lab and is working on understanding plasmonics in metallic nanostructures using correlated optical microscopy and STEM/EELS.

Title: Humanizing your Online Class - Oct. 9, 2013
Body:
All faculty are invited to view the webinar described below – either on your own, or as a group in M107 (on Wednesday, Oct. 9, starting at 3:00 p.m.).  Note that there’s evidently a ‘micro-MOOC’ on the same topic, open for registration – linked below.





 
Humans are social beings and learning is a social process.  Both require interaction and connection to flourish.  Do these factors undermine the effectiveness of an online class or strengthen it?  In our digital, mobile society are discussion forums still the most effective tool for student-student interactions?
 
On October 9 at 3 p.m. Eastern,  Academic Partnerships Faculty eCommons presents a free webinar featuring Michelle Pacansky-Brock, noted online instructor, faculty development specialist, and leader in the field of online education. Michelle will share examples of what students identify as valuable characteristics of a "humanized" online class and identify key tips and strategies for harnessing the potential of emerging technologies to make your online class personal, meaningful, and memorable.
 

 
This webinar is part of a larger online professional development Micro-MOOC, Human Element: An Essential Online Course Component, being delivered via the Canvas Network. You can join the MicroMOOC by clicking here.
 
Michelle Pacansky-Brock is a noted online instructor, faculty development specialist, and leader in the field of online education. She is currently serving as a member of the 2014 Horizon Project Higher Education Advisory Board and is chair-elect for the 2014 Sloan-C International Emerging Technologies Symposium for Online Learning. Michelle is also the author of Best Practices for Teaching with Emerging Technologies and How to Humanize Your Online Class with VoiceThread. She is an online associate faculty at Mt. San Jacinto College, an active speaker, consultant, and has received two Sloan-C Awards for her online teaching excellence.

Title: Need Honeybees
Body: I am in need of honeybees, if you are or know a beekeeper please contact davenpbh@rose-hulman.edu<mailto:davenpbh@rose-hulman.edu>  I am a senior Applied Biology major working on my senior thesis. I am investigating the viruses found within the guts of honeybees, with hopes of comparing hives that are afflicted with colony collapse disorder. Colony Collapse Disorder has been devastating hives since 2006 when large amounts of honeybees began disappearing. I am trying to collect diverse samples, so if you have any knowledge of individuals with bees or questions please contact me davenpbh@rose-hulman.edu<mailto:davenpbh@rose-hulman.edu>   Bryant Davenport Applied Biology May 2014

Title: Chemistry and Biochemistry Seminar
Body:
Dr. Fumie Sunahori
Wed. October 9, 2013
4th hour, G317
Matrix-Isolated Infrared Spectroscopy: Discovering New Molecules 
Matrix isolation is an experimental technique which can be used to trap reactive species which are short-lived and difficult to be studied by standard methods such as X-ray crystallography and mass spectrometer. By combining the matrix isolation and infrared spectroscopy techniques, molecular signatures of these transient species can be obtained. Reactive molecules I am particularly interested to study with this technique have a possibility of being found in space. With unique signatures of the potential interstellar molecules identified in the laboratory, astrochemists can search for radio signals emitted by these molecules from space by using a radio telescope. In this talk, I will describe the experimental method and discuss the importance of this research.

Title: Mini MOOC -  Humanizing Online Courses
Body:
Faculty may be interested in registering for the 'mini-MOOC' linked below, on Humanizing Online Courses. 
 
 The course objectives are:
·         Learn how to integrate educational technology tools into an online course with an emphasis on technology that can create an instructor presence or increase personal interaction.
·         Share insights and suggestions about how to “humanize” online courses by maximizing the use of flexible educational technology tools.
·         Demonstrate how technology-facilitated interactions can make instructors and learners more "real" online and how this correlates with student learning and retention.
Notes:
1.  It's a short course – it only runs Oct. 21 to Nov. 25.  Low time commitment.
2.  It's free, and we can drop out or stop participating at any time.  
3.  If it's good, we have something to imitate in our own courses; if it's bad we can drop out and avoid imitating it in our own courses.  We learn something either way.
4.  Connecting with our students is an important part of teaching at Rose-Hulman, and this course may give us ideas for creating personal connections in new ways, online.  
 https://www.canvas.net/courses/human-element-an-essential-online-course-component-1

Title: Parkour Beginners Workshop Tomorrow
Body:

.ExternalClassF0E9D16EAF0E45D78965ED8DA54AE7BA div.WordSection1
{page:WordSection1;}



Hello everyone,
                I will be hosting a beginners parkour workshop tomorrow (Wednesday October 9th) from 5-6pm in the Quad. During this workshop we will teach a few of the basic techniques and attempt to answer any questions you
 have about parkour. 
 
A bit about parkour:
Parkour is a training discipline in which you develop strength, agility, balance, flexibility, and endurance by practicing fundamental movement techniques including running, jumping, vaulting, and climbing. It was
 developed originally by the French militia as a form of obstacle training for efficient movement but has evolved to accommodate a wider range of movements since then. We focus on safe progressions of developing your self-awareness and mobility. Unlike the
 common misconception parkour isn’t about jumping off buildings, flipping, and being dangerous. It is about safely developing your abilities and increasing your level of fitness through training safe movements.

 
A bit about me:
I have been training for nearly 3 years and been to several teaching workshops. I have been teaching informally for about 2 years. In this time I have learned many techniques of how to help practitioners of all
 ages, skill levels, and fitness levels. I have spoken with several leaders in the practice about how to teach and how they have trained so that we can further develop the practice. I have competed in several national contests and placed in one of them.

 
I train most days of the week so if you aren’t able to come tomorrow but are still interested please email me to arrange a time to join or talk about the sport with me.

 
Thanks,
                Seth Rujiraviriyapinyo

Title: Dance Team Tryouts
Body:
Dance Team Tryouts 
 
Monday, October 14th 
9pm – 10pm 
SRC Multipurpose Room (MPR) 
 
Dance Team has a performance team and a practice team. The performance team is a more serious commitment whereas the practice team is open to everyone, even if you have never danced before. The performance team will meet three times a week, an hour each time. The practice team will be able to come on a drop-in basis and learn/experience different styles of dance. If you have ever danced before or would like to learn how to, consider coming to tryouts this Monday. A piece of choreography will be taught and you will have to perform it with a group of fellow students. You do not have to prepare anything for this tryout. If you can’t make the tryouts but are still interested please contact us. 
 
If you have any questions, feel free to email Morgan Anderer, anderemr@rose-hulman.edu or Giuliana Watson, watsonge@rose-hulman.edu.

Title: Chemistry and Biochemistry Seminar
Body:
Anne Wilson 
Professor of Chemistry, Butler University
    Wednesday
     October 16, 2013
    4th Hour
    G 315
“Microwave synthesis, a New Method or Just a Lot of Heat?”
 
Microwave synthesis has become much more popular in the synthetic literature, especially for organometallic catalysis in organic synthesis. Often, these synthetic pathways are higher yielding and give fewer side products. Several research projects will be presented that utilize microwave energy to provide the heating. We will then examine these different synthetic pathways and determine if microwave synthesis is a distinct method or simply another way to add heat to a reaction mixture.

Title: CURRICULUM DESIGN presented by Jeffrey Froyd, 10th period, 10/29
Body:
Curriculum DesignPresented by:Jeffrey E. FroydTEES Research Professor
Engineering Student Services and Academic Programs Dwight Look College of Engineering | Texas A&M University
Tuesday, October 29, 20134:20 p.m. in the GM Room
Abstract:  Curriculum design juxtaposes two ideas on which considerable work has been done separately: curriculum and design. However, it appears to be comparatively rare that scholarship on the two areas is merged. The seminar is intended to explore implications if a merger was attempted. For design methodology, the seminar will briefly consider the function-behavior-structure (FBS) framework. For curriculum, the seminar will briefly consider four lenses: content delivery, student development, certification/evaluation/accreditation, and instructor. These broad perspectives may help faculty members consider innovative alternative curriculum designs.
 
Bio:  Jeffrey E. Froyd served as Project Director for the Foundation Coalition, one of six NSF Engineering Education Coalitions. He co-created the Integrated, First-Year Curriculum in Science, Engineering and Mathematics at Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology, which TIAA-CREF recognized in 1997 with a Hesburgh Award Certificate of Excellence. He authored over 70 papers on engineering education, including many ASEE conference publications.  He has been the PI or co-PI on grants totaling over $35 million.  He is an ABET Program Evaluator, Editor-in-Chief for the IEEE Transactions, a Senior Associate Editor for the Journal on Engineering Education, an ASEE Fellow, and an IEEE Fellow.

Title: Basic/Intermediate Lync Training Curriculum
Body:
Basic/Intermediate Lync
Thursday, October 31, 2013
1:35 – 2:25 p.m. (7th Hour)
Logan Library – Public Computer Lab, Room L307
How well are you connected at RHIT and beyond? HR and IAIT are pleased to offer the first of a two part Lync Training Curriculum. Even the person that is the Lync’ster in your department will learn a thing or two from these sessions.
 
Below is a session summary and the list of topics for Session 1 -- Basic/Intermediate Lync
 
This session will cover the Lync interface and all of the common tasks which most people will use on a daily basis. It will include demonstrations of answering/making calls, placing calls on hold and transferring. There will be time at the end of the session for questions and to discuss the Polycom Lync phones, if desired.
 
Basic/Intermediate Lync
· Overview of Lync interface and common options
· Presence status
· Contact list
· Instant Messaging
· Managing calls
· Call forwarding
 
Please register via ANGEL and click on ROSExperience. 
 
Sign up and allow us to make you a Lync’ster. HR and IAIT refreshing your knowledge of one of the major communication tools here at RHIT.
 
We are there for you.
For more information, please contact Kelley Duggins at ext. 8518 or duggins1@rose-hulman.edu.

Title: Sloan Consortium - Free Account
Body:
Rose-Hulman is now an Institutional member of the Sloan Consortium, a well-respected international group dedicated to quality online education.  With this membership, any Rose-Hulman faculty or staff member can create a free account affiliated with Rose-Hulman at the Sloan-C website, and get access to research and publications, practitioner documents, the Journal of Asynchronous Learning Networks, free webinars, discounts on conference attendance and more.
Please note that this account is FREE.  Don't pay $129 for an 'individual membership!'  Instead, follow the directions below or in the attached PDF which includes screenshots of the process and more detailed instructions.  If you have any questions, please contact Kay C Dee.
 How do I create a free personal account affiliated with Rose-Hulman?
1.     Click here (http://sloanconsortium.org/user/register ) to create a free user account.
2.     Once you complete your registration, you will be sent an e-mail and asked to verify your account.
3.     Once logged in, click on your username in the upper right hand corner of the home page. You will be brought to your “My Account” page. Click on “Edit Profile” to affiliate your account. Please enter your name and organization in the spaces provided. (Please make sure the organization name you type in matches the one listed on the membership list.)
4.     The system will now recognize you as a member. Go to the member resources page for details on your membership benefits, such as free webinars and access to the JALN.

Title: IM Basketball and Volleyball Registration
Body:
* Registration begins today for IM Basketball, 3 vs. 3 Female Basketball & Volleyball.  The registration deadline for all 3 sports is on Friday, November 8th.  Please register your team on www.imleagues.com by the November 8th deadline date.  Also, I will send the captain's of each team an e-mail towards the end of the registration deadline with more details about Captain's and Sport Quizzes as well as info about forfeit fees. 
 
     
 
IM Basketball & Volleyball
 
Who:  Open to all Rose-Hulman students (not Rose-Hulman basketball players for IM basketball or Rose-Hulman volleyball players for IM volleyball), faculty, and staff.  There will be Residence Hall, Greek, Independent, and Coed leagues for both Intramural Sports.  Coed leagues are a great way for female fraternities and residence hall floors to interact and participate in Intramurals.  If you are interested in participating in the coed league, but do not know who to contact, please e-mail me at barrett1@rose-hulman.edu.  Also, we will be offering 3 vs. 3 Female Only Basketball League.  Females from Res Halls, Greek Affiliations, and Independent leagues are strongly encouraged to join this league. 
 
What:  Intramural Basketball, 3 vs. 3 Female Only Basketball and Volleyball leagues. 
 
When:  Registration begins today, Tuesday, October 29th.  The Registration Deadline for both IM Basketball and Volleyball is Friday, November 8th.  To register a team, please log onto www.IMLeagues.com.  Click the Create Team button at the top right of your User Homepage page.  Games will begin on Monday, December 2nd for Basketball leagues and Wednesday, December 4th for Volleyball. 
 
Where:  Intramural Basketball and Volleyball will both be played in the Sports and Recreation Center.  Basketball will use both the SRC Hulbert Arena and Fieldhouse and Volleyball will use only the Fieldhouse.
 
How to Register:  Log in to your IMLeagues.com account.  Click the Create Team button at the top right of your User Homepage page or click the Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology link to go to your school's homepage of IMLeagues.  The current sports will be displayed, click on the sport you wish to join.  Choose the league you wish to play in (Greek A, Res Hall B, Independent C, etc...). 
 
Why:  Intramural points will be awarded to the winning Residence Hall, Greek, and Independent teams towards the Intramural All Sport Championship (the Residence Hall, Independent team, and Fraternity who have the most points at the end of the year will be awarded the overall Intramural Sports Champions).  Awards will also be given to the winning teams (either mugs or t-shirts).
 
Cost:  A $10 forfeit fee is required .  Please be sure to submit your $10 forfeit fee to the IM Office before the IM season begins.  Your team will NOT be allowed to participate until the $10 forfeit fee is submitted.  More details will be e-mailed to team captains. 
 
Free Agents:  An Intramural Free Agent is a Rose-Hulman student, faculty or staff member who wishes to participate in an Intramural sponsored team activity and is not currently a member of a team.  Agent List will be posted in the Intramural Office.  If you would like to be put on the Free Agent List, please do so by e-mailing Jordan Barrett at barrett1@rose-hulman.edu.  When e-mailing, please include name, sport you would like to join, contact number, and e-mail address.
 
Additional Information:  Instructions on how to create either an IM Basketball or Volleyball team on IMLeagues.com is attached to this posting.  You can also find a copy of the rules for all three sports attached.  If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact Jordan Barrett at either ext. 8961 or barrett1@rose-hulman.edu.  Thanks!
 
* We have replaced the in-person captain’s meeting with a mandatory captain’s quiz.  All major sports (flag football, indoor soccer, basketball, volleyball, ultimate frisbee, and softball) must have a team captain complete the quiz with a 100% accuracy.  The team captain will have multiple attempts at completing the quiz until they receive a perfect score.
 
Thanks,
Jordan Barrett
Asst. Director for Rec Sports & Athletic Facilities/Director of Intramurals & Sport Clubs
Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology
5500 Wabash Avenue, CM37
Terre Haute, IN  47803
Phone: (812)877-8961
Fax: (812)877-8969
Website: www.rose-hulman.edu/Intramurals
